page.home.head.title: Al-Muntada - The Arab Academic Imprint
homepage.title: Al-Muntada
homepage.subtitle: Aspiring to provide academics with the opportunity to establish an Arab academic network for multilateral sharing of knowledge related to the academic world.
homepage.description: Almuntada – The Arab Academic Imprint is a forum aiming for the advancement of academic achievements in the Arabic community. It does so by providing a platform for Arab academics of various educational backgrounds to meet, network, exchange experiences and create new opportunities.  Moreover, the forum aims to place itself as the main reference for the younger generation hoping to pursue an academic degree.
homepage.about_2: We believe that education in general and taking part in an academic journey in specific is considered one of the means for shrinking the gaps of poverty.
homepage.description_2:
Studies have shown that the percentage of Arab academics is lower than Jewish academics in the country. 
The Arab society faces many challenges represented in the socio-economic gaps, which is also reflected in the educational system in general and in the employment opportunities in specific.  Our forum would like to join the voices calling for fighting poverty.
homepage.impact.sub.title: We are the ones making the future
homepage.impact.desc: The concepts of social impact of the project and its’ value through mutual cooperation, as well as the creation of common financial and emotional values for a community of Arab academics.
homepage.vision.sub.title: Our vision
homepage.vision.desc: An Arab Academic Platform created to leave a social trace in local leadership.
homepage.message.sub.title: Our message
homepage.message.desc: This forum stives for closing the social gaps though being a supportive and cooperative platform.
homepage.missfix.sub.title: Acknowledgment and support
homepage.missfix.desc:
The “Miss Fix” competition for social impact was held in September 2022, a competition held by the women’ lobby “Shdulat Nashim” sponsored by “Bank Hapoalim”.
The competition is set to allow shedding light on social initiatives as well as to women taking part in such initiatives. The fundamental values on which the competition evaluates the participating initiatives are: social justice, equality, sustainability, health, technology and human rights. These values would allow for a variety of initiatives to take part in the competition, focusing on those led by women entrepreneurs. 
183 women had participated in the 2022 competition, presenting a variety of initiatives. Over 70 thousand voters had voted for the various initiates in that competition. The “Al-Muntada” project won 2nd place.
homepage.goals.title: Our goals

homepage.goals.desc:
Management and operation: 
Al-Muntada is a social platform for academy students as well as academy graduates in the Arab society. The platform is constantly growing and evolving as is open for new members wanting to take part in knowledge sharing, cooperation, and much more.

Academic podcast “let’s hear you”:
The podcast will host academics who will be sharing their experience in the academy as well as in their career. The podcast aims to raise awareness for the possibilities that the Arab community could seek in the studies field, as well as in possible career paths.

Information services: 
Al-Muntada platform will allow members to share information and knowledge about the academic life and possible career paths.

homepage.founder.title: Founders

homepage.founders.name: Hassan Hassouna
homepage.founders.desc: A graduate of a bachelor degree in Information Systems Management from Tel Aviv-Yafo Academic College.

homepage.founders.name: Ala Hasouna
homepage.founders.desc: a bachelor's degree in economics and management from Tel Aviv-Yafo Academic, a pension marketer's license from the Ministry of Finance, a master's degree in business administration from Ben Gurion University and a doctoral degree in management from Bar Ilan University.

homepage.cofounders.title: Board members

homepage.cofounders.name: Hanaa adsi
homepage.cofounders.desc: A biology graduate with a master's in biochemistry, Hanaa is currently pursuing a doctoral degree in biological sciences and biochemistry at Tel Aviv University.

homepage.cofounders.name: Ahmed Hasona
homepage.cofounders.desc: A graduate of Or Yehuda College with a bachelor's degree in social education, and a master's degree in management and organization of formal and informal education systems, of krait ono.

homepage.cofounders.name: Kayan Bsoul
homepage.cofounders.desc: A graduate of a bachelor degree in pharmacy, B.Sc.Pharm by the Hebrew university of Jerusalem. Also a graduate of  Masters in Law from Bar Ilan university.

homepage.cofounders.name: Nahad Abu Din
homepage.cofounders.desc: a student pursuing a bachelor's degree in informal education, is an expert in neurolinguistic programming.

homepage.cofounders.name: Nicholas Zakach
homepage.cofounders.desc: a Tel Aviv Jaffa Academic College graduate and Ramat Gan Academic College graduate, holds a bachelor's degree in nursing and health systems

homepage.cofounders.name: Safa Abu-Sbeet
homepage.cofounders.desc: BSc degree from Ben Gurion University in the field of Chemistry and is now a student for a master's degree in business administration.

academicpage.title: The Arab Academic list
academicpage.text: Our ability to communicate and collaborate with one another as an Arab society is the key to societal change for the better. Join us for a listing of Arab academics of various academic backgrounds and specializations from all around the country.
